intro: Ancipitia nelsonii, commonly known as the Nelson's antler plant, is a unique flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, antler-like inflorescences. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red and purple. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in its native region.
